target_assessment.notes: Model correctly identified the unprotected initialization vulnerability in the initwallet() function.

other_findings.model_claim: The initialized flag is set but never checked. Any owner or attacker can call initWallet() multiple times to replace all owners and take complete control of any wallet. The initialized variable serves no protective purpose.
other_findings.reasoning: The model correctly identified a critical security flaw in the initWallet function, where the initialized flag is set but never checked, allowing any user to call initWallet() multiple times and gain control of the wallet.

other_findings.model_claim: The kill() function uses selfdestruct. If called on the library contract directly (after attacker takes ownership via unprotected initWallet), the library is destroyed. All proxy contracts become bricked - delegatecalls return success but do nothing.
other_findings.reasoning: The model correctly identified a critical security flaw in the kill function, where the use of selfdestruct can lead to the destruction of the library contract, rendering all proxy contracts non-functional.
